newsitem.title: NORWAY: Statoil, Norsk Hydro mull oil, gas terminal links.
newsitem.headline: Statoil, Norsk Hydro mull oil, gas terminal links.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap AS and Norsk Hydro AS are considering laying pipelines between the oil and gas plants at Kollsnes, Mongstad and Sture, all on the west coast of Norway, to optimise utilisation of the facilities, Statoil's Status Weekly newsletter said on Thursday.

"The idea is to achieve better use of existing infrstructure," said John Stangenes, manager of the Troll field development department in Bergen. "That includes pipelines, jetties, tank farms and refinery capacity."

Pipeline links between the plants would enhance flexibility for storage and tanker loading and could also provide a more effective gas solution on the Oseberg field in the North Sea, Status Weekly said.
Capacity at the Mongstad refinery would also be used more efficiently, it said.
The first part of a study, dubbed the West Process project, is due before the end of the year.
